3.title: front-end developer

4.title: react native developer - engineering department
4.posting:
job description

who we are:
we think bigger than an agency and more creatively than a consultancy with the power to integrate the whole system. we are ibm interactive experience, we are a next generation services company dedicated to creating transformative ideas that get our clients to the future first.

as a contributor to the team, you'll share knowledge and collaborate with your team to address ambiguous, complex problems and projects. you'll apply user experience, design thinking, information architecture methods to uncover user and business requirements in the context of the technical landscape; while evaluating the effectiveness and adequacy of existing/proposed solutions. it is expected that you will work with a senior team member to establish priority, fidelity and delivery of tasks.

what you will do:
as frontend developer you are working independently in an agile team, on international projects. you�ll be working asides ux designers, industry consultants and fellow developers on mobile and web-based applications. you�ll use future proof solutions, provide creative input towards the team and foster the transformation of ibm from within.

some things that are important to us:
react js and react native - we want you to be a great javascript developer, but you should have a good understanding of mobile development and best practices as well.
ability to work as part of a distributed team in a self-directed way with strong communication skills. flexibility, teamwork, empathy, a sense of humor and courage to challenge the status quo are must haves in this environment


required technical and professional expertise

experience with popular react workflows (such as redux, react-router, reselect, etc.).
development experience using an agile methodology such as kanban, lean, scrum, ...
ability to break down requirements into small releases and increments of work to allow for iterative development.
translate ideas and business requirements or high-fidelity designs into quality code given a common ui toolkit and at times a simple wireframe.
experience in developing and consuming restful apis.
exposure and interest in full stack development, think �t-shaped� developer.
you take a product-first approach to building software where you care about the user experience and real-world functionality of your programming.
knowledge around automated testing.
strong debugging skills with the ability to reach out and work with peers to solve complex problems.
native level in dutch or french and fluent in the other national language

preferred tech and prof experience

bachelor degree in it

eo statement
ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. ibm is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

5.title: internship 3: visualisation is key in cognitive clarity
5.posting:
stage / apprentissagecontext:

to find information you need in a large haystack of tables and text, new type of interfaces (cognitive) need to be developed, using left and right brain thinking. building upon a master thesis by martijn millecamp, we want to build a sunburst type of user interface to summarize large results set in an easy to navigate sunburst control.

goal:

to select technology (d3, other..) to build a very elegant and interactive sunburst. after selection, this needs to be integrated into our react based finder application. we also want to investigate reusing graphical elements from great interface like kibana (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/kibana/6.x/vega-vs-vegalite.html) to make our finder interface more appealing and intuitive..

tasks:
investigate technology
investigate best way to integrate in react.js framework
develop and benchmark the new sunburst visualisation in finder
do usability tests and improve the control.


what xenit offers:

you will get the opportunity to learn and develop great things as part of an inspiring team
you will get a great introduction in alfresco, the largest open source ecm
happy at xenit? you will get the opportunity to do more work with us afterwards!

6.title: junior developer (w/m)

7.title: application developer intern 2019 internship/stage
7.posting:
stage / apprentissagejob description
our team in brussels is helping our clients fight terrorism, support national defense, and ensure safety of belgian and european citizens. we help clients to expertly staff their teams and support their technical projects using augmented intelligence. we develop innovative platforms for intelligence analysis, defense operations, and back office optimizations using industry leading capabilities such as cognitive computing, big data analytics, and design thinking. our interns inject new thinking, and help us implement existing and new requirements, and audition for future employment.

what you will do:
develop and enhance modern web or mobile applications
work with a variety of data source including: open source, big data, and proprietary databases
deploy applications in modern cloud-based environments while applying devops techniques
work with modern web application and web service frameworks such as: react js, graphql, and others to develop scalable applications
as an intern, you will:
apply ibms cognitive watson technologies to solve real client problems
work in a multi-disciplinary technology consulting team
work in a project-based environment with other interns and ibm mentors.
have access to ibm�s global technology capabilities and expertise
own and execute your own project from beginning to end

required technical and professional expertise

having a demonstrated experience developing web and/or mobile applications
applied understanding of data structures
expertise of at least one modern programming language, such as: javascript, python, etc.
fluent english (reading, writing and speaking)
do not hesitate to apply to join us on our ibm journey! this internship will allow you gain experience in design thinking, agile development and automated testing.

if you are interested, please apply by providing both a cover letter and a resume.

preferred tech and prof experience

computer science major is a plus.

eo statement
ibm is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. ibm is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
